lib/hope/memory/small_object/fixed_allocator.h

00009 #pragma once
00010 
00011 #include "hope/memory/small_object/chunk.h"
00012 #include <vector>
00013 #include <algorithm>
00014 
00015 namespace hope::memory {
00016 
00017     class fixed_allocator final {
00018         using chunk_list = std::vector<chunk>;
00019     public:
00020         fixed_allocator(uint8_t max_blocks_count, std::size_t block_size) noexcept;
00021         fixed_allocator(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept;
00022         fixed_allocator& operator=(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept;
00023         ~fixed_allocator() noexcept;
00024 
00030         fixed_allocator(const fixed_allocator& rhs) = delete;
00031         fixed_allocator& operator=(const fixed_allocator& rhs) = delete;
00032 
00036         void* allocate() noexcept;
00037 
00043         void deallocate(void* ptr) noexcept;
00044 
00048         [[nodiscard]] std::size_t block_size() const noexcept;
00049     private:
00055         void update_dealloc_chunk(void* ptr) noexcept;
00056 
00061         [[nodiscard]] bool update_alloc_chunk() noexcept;
00062 
00066         [[nodiscard]] bool can_be_deallocated(const chunk& chunk, void* ptr) const noexcept;
00067 
00072         [[nodiscard]] chunk create_new_chunk() const noexcept;
00073 
00077         void update_free_chunk() noexcept;
00078 
00083         void steal_resources(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept;
00084 
00085         std::size_t         m_block_size;                   // size of single block in the chunk
00086         chunk_list          m_chunk_list;                   // list of allocated chunks
00087         chunk*              m_last_allocated{ nullptr };    // last allocation was held in this chunk, cannot be nullptr
00088         chunk*              m_last_deallocated{ nullptr };  // last deallocation was held in this chunk, cannot be nullptr
00089         chunk*              m_free_block{ nullptr };        // completely deallocated block, is used to recycle deallocated blocks and avoid new\delete utilization
00090         uint8_t             m_blocks_in_chunk;              // count of blocks, contains in one chunk
00091     };
00092 
00093     inline fixed_allocator::fixed_allocator(uint8_t max_blocks_count, std::size_t block_size) noexcept
00094         : m_block_size(block_size)
00095         , m_blocks_in_chunk(max_blocks_count)
00096     {
00097         try {
00098             // thus, we remove one extra compare 
00099             m_chunk_list.push_back(create_new_chunk());
00100             m_last_allocated = &m_chunk_list.front();
00101         } catch(const std::exception&) {
00102             assert(false);
00103         }
00104     }
00105 
00106     inline fixed_allocator::fixed_allocator(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept {  // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-member-init)
00107         steal_resources(std::move(rhs));
00108     }
00109 
00110     inline fixed_allocator& fixed_allocator::operator=(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept {
00111         steal_resources(std::move(rhs));
00112         return *this;
00113     }
00114 
00115     inline fixed_allocator::~fixed_allocator() noexcept {
00116         for (auto& chunk : m_chunk_list)
00117             delete[] chunk.data;
00118     }
00119 
00120     inline void* fixed_allocator::allocate() noexcept {
00121         if (m_last_allocated->free_blocks_count == 0
00122             && !update_alloc_chunk()) {
00123             try {
00124                 m_chunk_list.push_back(create_new_chunk());
00125             } catch (const std::exception&) {
00126                 assert(false);
00127                 return nullptr;
00128             }    
00129             m_last_allocated = &m_chunk_list.back();
00130             // If std::vector were reallocated m_last_deallocated could be invalid
00131             // i decide to assign this var to the middle of vec is not bad idea
00132             m_last_deallocated = &m_chunk_list[m_chunk_list.size() / 2];
00133         }
00134         return m_last_allocated->allocate(m_block_size);
00135     }
00136 
00137     inline void fixed_allocator::deallocate(void* ptr) noexcept {
00138         if (m_last_deallocated == nullptr 
00139             || !can_be_deallocated(*m_last_deallocated, ptr))
00140             update_dealloc_chunk(ptr);
00141         m_last_deallocated->deallocate(ptr, m_block_size);
00142         update_free_chunk();
00143     }
00144 
00145     inline std::size_t fixed_allocator::block_size() const noexcept {
00146         return m_block_size;
00147     }
00148 
00149     inline void fixed_allocator::update_dealloc_chunk(void* ptr) noexcept {
00150         const auto chunk_it = std::find_if(std::begin(m_chunk_list), std::end(m_chunk_list),
00151             [=](const auto& ch) {
00152                         return can_be_deallocated(ch, ptr);
00153         });
00154         assert(chunk_it != std::end(m_chunk_list));
00155         m_last_deallocated = &*chunk_it;
00156     }
00157 
00158     inline bool fixed_allocator::update_alloc_chunk() noexcept {
00159         const auto chunk_it = std::find_if(std::begin(m_chunk_list), std::end(m_chunk_list), 
00160             [=](const auto& ch) {
00161                         return ch.free_blocks_count > 0;
00162         });
00163         const bool isFound = chunk_it != std::end(m_chunk_list);
00164         if (isFound)
00165         {
00166             m_last_allocated = &*chunk_it;
00167             if (m_free_block == m_last_allocated)
00168                 m_free_block = nullptr;
00169         }
00170         return isFound;
00171     }
00172 
00173     inline bool fixed_allocator::can_be_deallocated(const chunk& chunk, void* ptr) const noexcept {
00174         return ptr >= chunk.data && ptr < chunk.data + m_block_size * m_blocks_in_chunk;
00175     }
00176 
00177     inline chunk fixed_allocator::create_new_chunk() const noexcept {
00178         chunk ch;
00179         ch.init(m_block_size, m_blocks_in_chunk);
00180         return ch;
00181     }
00182 
00183     inline void fixed_allocator::update_free_chunk() noexcept {
00184         if (m_last_deallocated->free_blocks_count != m_blocks_in_chunk)
00185             return;
00186         if(m_free_block != nullptr && m_chunk_list.size() > 1){
00187             const std::size_t dist = m_last_deallocated - m_chunk_list.data();
00188             const auto begin = std::begin(m_chunk_list) + dist;
00189             delete[] begin->data;
00190             m_chunk_list.erase(begin);
00191             m_last_allocated = m_last_deallocated = &m_chunk_list[m_chunk_list.size() / 2];
00192         } else if (m_free_block == nullptr){
00193             m_free_block = m_last_deallocated;
00194         }
00195     }
00196 
00197     inline void fixed_allocator::steal_resources(fixed_allocator&& rhs) noexcept {
00198         m_block_size = rhs.m_block_size;
00199         m_blocks_in_chunk = rhs.m_blocks_in_chunk;
00200         m_chunk_list = std::move(rhs.m_chunk_list);
00201         assert(rhs.m_chunk_list.empty());
00202         m_last_allocated = rhs.m_last_allocated;
00203         m_last_deallocated = rhs.m_last_deallocated;
00204         m_free_block = rhs.m_free_block;
00205         rhs.m_free_block = rhs.m_last_allocated = rhs.m_last_deallocated = nullptr;
00206     }
00207 }
